You need to recommend a feature that allow users to edit Dynamic 365 data by using Microsoft Office. Changes that you make in Microsoft Office must update
Dynamic 365.
What should you recommend? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content: Correct

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
A company implements Dynamics 365 finance and operations apps. You need to describe the shared features that are available to technical and business users to company stakeholders.
Instructions: For each of the following statements, select Yes if the statement is true. Otherwise, select No.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

comments.content: It does not matter if you have selected a grid or not, the export to excel exports all the visible grid and not the content of the selected grid. (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/learn/modules/get-introduced-finance-operations-apps/5-explore-options-for-exporting-excel)
It does not export anything, it just opens the data in excel - so I guess, the answer is correct..

discussion.content:
If records have been selected, Export to Excel will export the selected rows, but it does so regardless of whether they are currently visible or not.
On the other hand, if no records have been selected, all returned records are exported.

The question is a bit sneaky, but given that it talks about selected lines, then the correct answer should be Yes.
in d365, when export it will only export the selected lines, is not that what que question means? why no?
Question 2 should be YES; I use Export to Excel constantly; if certain lines are selected it will export those lines, but if none are selected it will export ALL the visible lines.

1st: YES
2nd: NO, the question is tricky : ... that is visible in a grid ..., no it schouldn't be visible. If you filtered the list, and klick select all, than it will be exported into the excel.
For me answer 2 is also "YES", you can just try it yourself with filtered or selected data.
The Export to Excel feature exports all the grid data to an Excel workbook

Microsoft Teams integration is not supported on the following:

Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement (on-premises)
Microsoft Dataverse environment
Legacy web client or legacy apps
If Dynamics 365 and Microsoft Teams are in different tenants

Answer is correct (ABE) 

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/teams-integration/teams-integration
NOTE:
Microsoft Teams integration is not supported on the following:

Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement (on-premises)
Microsoft Dataverse environment
Legacy web client or legacy apps
If Dynamics 365 and Microsoft Teams are in different tenants
Mobile devices

The three platforms that support Microsoft Teams integration are:

A. Dynamics 365 Commerce
C. Microsoft Dataverse
E. SharePoint Online

Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations is not listed as one of the options. Power BI is a separate business analytics service and while it can be integrated with Teams, it is not a direct integration for Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations. Therefore, options A, C, and E are the correct answers.

comments.content: Bro are u stupid from the head

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BCE
Options A and D are incorrect as they are not platforms that support Microsoft Teams integration. Dynamics 365 Commerce is a retail and e-commerce solution, and Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement (on-premises) is a customer relationship management solution that does not have native support for Microsoft Teams integration.
integration with Power BI and Sharepoint https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/modern-analytics-teams/

questions.question_text:
A company plans to implement Dynamics 365 finance and operations apps. The company wants to integrate Microsoft Teams with these applications.
Which three platforms support Microsoft Teams integration? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

HOTSPOT
-

An oil refinery uses Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management. They create work orders for their equipment and machinery.

The refinery needs to perform equipment and machinery maintenance according to internal requests.

Which maintenance type is performed in enterprise asset management based on internal requests? To answer, select the appropriate option in the answer area.

//IMG//

discussion.content: In enterprise asset management, the maintenance type that is performed based on internal requests is known as "Corrective Maintenance". Corrective Maintenance involves repairing equipment or machinery that has failed or is malfunctioning, in order to restore it to its proper working condition. These requests can be generated from various sources, such as operator observations, routine inspections, or other maintenance work orders. Once the request is made, a work order can be created and scheduled to perform the necessary corrective maintenance activities.

In enterprise asset management (EAM), maintenance based on internal requests typically falls under Corrective Maintenance. This type of maintenance is reactive, responding to issues or requests that arise internally rather than being planned in advance.
Options B, C, and E are correct. Vendors cannot change the inventory cost of items or approve purchase orders as these are actions that only authorized employees of the company can perform.
the correct answers are B, D, and E. Vendors cannot change the inventory cost of items or create transfer orders, as these actions are typically reserved for internal users within the organization.

Selected Answer: BDE
I think A and C are the stuff that buyers can perform instead of vendors.

Selected Answer: BDE
B, D, and E.

I think that "D. Approve purchase orders." is correct:
"When vendors respond to a PO that you send them, they see one of three message boxes, where they must confirm that they want to accept the PO, reject it, or accept it with changes."
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/supply-chain/procurement/vendor-collaboration-work-external-vendors#defining-the-information-that-is-shown-to-vendors-when-they-respond-to-pos

Selected Answer: BCE
Options A and D are incorrect as vendors cannot change the inventory cost of items or approve purchase orders, as these are typically controlled by the company's procurement and finance teams.

choices.E: Respond to a request for quote (RFQ).
choices.A: Change the inventory cost of items.
